message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CE, cs.DS, cs.AI. 

The paper discusses the use of learning-to-rank techniques in the context of uplift modeling, which involves predicting the effect of a treatment on an individual's behavior. This falls under the broad category of machine learning (cs.LG) and information retrieval (cs.IR), as uplift modeling is often used in marketing and customer retention. Additionally, the paper proposes a new metric for learning-to-rank called promoted cumulative gain (PCG), which could also fall under the category of computational engineering (cs.CE). The use of LambdaMART, a gradient boosting algorithm, suggests a focus on data science (cs.DS) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
